title.native: 東京マーブルチョコレート

description:
Serious and generous, but a bit shy, Yuudai has been unsuccessful with the opposite gender.
Chizuru is an energetic and cheerful girl, but when it comes to boyfriends, she's been unlucky and clumsy, and never had a steady relationship. This is the first Christmas the couple spends together. Chizuru loves animals and Yuudai plans to give her a rabbit in a box, but it turns out to be... a mini donkey?! As the funny creature escapes, Chizuru goes after it, and Yuudai loses sight of them both!

The time that should have been spent together...
The important feeling that should have been revealed...
Small, but precious things that tend to be buried in every day life.
What answer will the two youngsters find while separated from each other?

Yuudai and Chizuru - their feelings and the time they spent far from each other are delicately unfolded in this double-sided pure love story told from two different perspectives!

(Source: Production I.G.)

title.native: 東京マーブルチョコレート　ハロー、グッバイ、ハロー。

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/松本憲生)

Originating from Tatsunoko's animators training institute, where he met [Atsushi Wakabayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105805/). Though primarily an action animator, he’s demonstrated impressive range elsewhere like in his scenes for [Haibane Renmei](https://anilist.co/anime/387/) and [Kaguya-hime](https://anilist.co/anime/16664/). He has the reputation of a fast and disciplined worker. [Toshiyuki Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/103724/) said that he must have a “secret” for producing such a large volume of superb cuts.

Though one of his earliest assignments was as an in-betweens checker for [Akira](https://anilist.co/anime/47/), his first major job was on [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/), working under the director of the series, [Kazuhiro Furuhashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100655/). He would collaborate with Furuhashi again on Rurouni Kenshin, [You’re Under Arrest](https://anilist.co/anime/1577/), and [Hunter x Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/136/). Around this time Matsumoto was also mentored by [Tomohiro Hirata](https://anilist.co/staff/122071/) on [Irresponsible Captain Tylor](https://anilist.co/anime/569/).

Matsumoto’s character animation is loose and full of smears, often looking like featureless masses in individual frames. He draws smoke without highlights, a tendency that earned the nickname “Norio smoke” and has been imitated by animators like [Shingo Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/114914/) and [Kenichi Kutsuna](https://anilist.co/staff/116007/). He occasionally storyboards his own scenes as he did for the 12th episode of [Birdy Decode:02](https://anilist.co/anime/5074/), the [third Naruto movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2144/), and episodes 31 & 85 of [Rurouni Kenshin](https://anilist.co/anime/45/). Prefers battles that take place in wide-open spaces with lots of forward momentum and background movement. Influenced by [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/) and [Takashi Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/102031/), and has adapted elements of their approach for a wider audience.

Whenever he serves as animation director on an episode, he does a lot of the key animation work himself. He also soloed the 7th episode of [Eat-Man](https://anilist.co/anime/1704/) and the [Kuragehime](https://anilist.co/anime/8129/) ED. He failed attempting to solo the 39th episode of You’re Under Arrest, and requested his name not be on the telop despite animating the vast majority of the episode.

Famous for his work on the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/) franchise, in which he often collaborated with Atsushi Wakabayashi.

As a well known animator with a wide network of connections, he regularly helps and receives help from his friends.

(Source: Animators Wiki)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_7265687568142)

Freelancer with a desk at [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/). Nakajima is strongly associated with the animated adaptations of the works of [Rumiko Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/96891/), having worked as an animation director on [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/), [Maison Ikkoku](https://anilist.co/anime/1453/) and [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/) also also serving as the character designer on latter.

She is married to [Tomohiro Hirata](https://anilist.co/staff/122071/).

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/shichiro_kobayashi/)

A former art director and a guest professor at Kobe Design University.

Kobayashi graduated from Musashino Art University and first became an elementary school art teacher. It was only later that he joined the animation industry in 1964. He started quickly making a name for himself as a background artist and consequently established his own background art studio Kobayashi Production, in 1968. During this time thick poster paint was dominating the backgrounds in anime, but Kobayashi started a new style with much thinner painting and colored pencil strokes.

He has worked as an art director on over 100 titles and is one of the most distinguished art directors in the medium. Notable works include [Gamba no Bouken](https://anilist.co/anime/5267/), [Ie Naki Ko](https://anilist.co/anime/2828/), [Takarajima](https://anilist.co/anime/2618/), [Tenshi no Tamago](https://anilist.co/anime/885/), [Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/), [Berserk](https://anilist.co/anime/33/) and [Nodame Cantabile](https://anilist.co/anime/1698/).

Kobayashi retired from the industry in 2010, which was followed by his studio's closedown a year later.

In a 2015 [interview](https://youtu.be/V1tiKOsCz2M), Kobayashi talked about his life and passion in painting touring his atelier and showcasing his work.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大塚舞)

Originating from [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/). Currently freelance.

Aspired to become an animator after having seen [Densetsu no Yuusha Da Garn](https://anilist.co/anime/2803/).

Sukima Switch (スキマスイッチ?) is a Japanese jazz fusion duo consisting of core members Takuya Ōhashi (大橋卓弥 Ōhashi Takuya?), born May 9, 1978, and Shintarō Tokita (常田真太郎 Tokita Shintarō?), born February 25, 1978, formed in 2003. Formerly with BMG Japan (bought by SMEJ in early 2009), they signed with Sony Music Japan's Ariola Japan label in September 2009.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/931752627359977472)

Currently mainly active at [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/).

Yoshigaki joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) after graduating from Yoyogi Animation School. There he immediately got along with fellow animator [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/), who joined the studio at the same time. Imaishi says that Yoshigaki is the "ideal animator."

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/170696565)

Shiotani grew up admiring Ghibli films and Ghost in the Shell, so he decided to enroll in an animation school in order to be able to participate in the creating process of anime. After graduating he joined [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/) becoming one of their most promising young animators. 

After some years spent climbing to the position of animation director on series such as [Windy Tales](https://anilist.co/anime/1524/Windy-Tales/), he left his first creative mark on the industry by directing, storyboarding and supervising [Blood+](https://anilist.co/anime/150/)'s kaleidoscopic 3rd Opening. 

He had his directorial debut with [Tokyo Marble Chocolate](https://anilist.co/anime/3088/), OVA produced as a collaboration between Production I.G. and BMG Japan in commemoration of both companies' 20th anniversaries. The OVA was awarded the Grand Prize in the Feature Film Category of the 12th Seoul International Cartoon & Animation Festival in 2008.

Shiotani is most famous for being the director of the [Psycho-Pass](https://anilist.co/anime/13601/) series. Initially planned with a post-apocalyptic setting, the concept changed after the Great East Japan Earthquake and evolved into its final form. The series is inspired by detective crime stories and sci-fi (Minority Report, Blade Runner, Ghost in the Shell, Patlabor) with the precise intent of exploring societal problems.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asanovic7) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/asanovic7/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/asanovic7/)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). One of the founding members of [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

Married to [Reiko Sakai](https://anilist.co/staff/148052/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asanovic7) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/asanovic7/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/asanovic7/)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). One of the founding members of [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

Married to [Reiko Sakai](https://anilist.co/staff/148052/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asanovic7) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/asanovic7/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/asanovic7/)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). One of the founding members of [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

Married to [Reiko Sakai](https://anilist.co/staff/148052/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1584883706858074112) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=arifumi_imai) 

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Currently freelance, with strong ties to [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

While being an accomplished animator on [Guilty Crown](https://anilist.co/anime/10793/) and [Sengoku Basara](https://anilist.co/anime/5355/), he gained notoriety as an Action Animation Director for [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/). Imai, together with Director [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088/), CG Director [Shuuhei Yabuta](https://anilist.co/staff/120824/), and fellow animator [Yasuyuki Ebara](https://anilist.co/staff/133640/), conceptualized how Attack on Titan's ODM gear should move in animation, and Imai himself storyboarded and animated many of its action set pieces. 

Married to [Hisako Akagi](https://anilist.co/staff/134516/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ozaki_t) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ozaki32/) | [Tumblr](https://ozaki3.tumblr.com/)

Tomomi Ozaki is a freelance illustrator, designer and an infrequent animator. She has provided design works to various anime series.

She is married to fellow illustrator and designer, [toi8](https://anilist.co/staff/112641/Toi8).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gwada_wit)

President of [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Co-founder and representative director of [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).
